reviewText: Interesting collection and part of our library. Character is typical slapstick humor that today is more common, but still elementally funny.

For any collector of silent comedies, this Ben Turpin collection is a must. Sadly there is very little now available on this prolific comedian with the million dollar eyes. Picture quality of these three comedies is as good as I have ever seen, but of course far from pristine.

First let me say that ALL of these have been restored on other DVD/Blu-ray sets.! Ben Turpin and his trademark crossed-eyes shot to super-stardom when he joined Mack Sennett's studio in 1917. At the height of his career he would introduce himself with, "I'm Ben Turpin; I make $3000 a week." Hardly an overnight success, he had worked for decades in the circus, vaudeville, burlesque and film before being signed by Sennett. There, his comicpotential was maximized by casting him against type, as when he plays a sophisticated playboy. With the advent of sound motion pictures, he retired, having made a fortune with wise real estate investment. He occasionally returned to movies for highly-paid cameos. Viewing his work almost a century later, he is still hilarious. This is NOT the best of Ben Turpin, one is really a Charlie Chaplin comedy with an appearance from Ben, another is from Ben's decline at the Weiss Brothers Studios. Only 'A Clever Dummy' is from the best years of Ben Turpin. A Clever Dummy (1917, B&W, Silent): Ben impersonates a mechanical man in a attempt to win over the young lady who has captured his heart. Starring Ben Turpin, Chester Conklin, Wallace Beery; Directed by H. Raymaker, Ferris Hartman & Robert Kerr. +++A fully restored version is on Flicker Alley's Mack Sennett Collection volume 1 Blu-ray The Mack Sennett Collection, Vol. One [Blu-ray] A Night Out (1915, B&W, Silent): from the ESSANAY STUDIOS. Starring Charlie Chaplin, Edna Purviance; Ben Turpin, by Charlie Chaplin. This is really a Charlie Chaplin comedy that Ben appears in. +++A quality version of this appears in the Chaplin Essanay Collection Volume 1 Chaplin's Essanay Comedies, Vol. 01+++ Idle Eyes (1928, B&W, Silent): This is a WEISS BROTHERS comedy, if you have not heard of the Weiss Brothers comedies, there is a good reason: THEY ARE NOT VERY GOOD. Starring Ben Turpin (Playing a tramp) , Georgia O'Dell, Helen Gilmore, Billy Barty; Directed Leslie Goodwins. +++This is also on the "Silent Comedy Mafia Volume 1" DVD.The Silent Comedy Mafia #1+++
